item.title: “If you don’t like to read, you haven’t found the right book.”
item.description: Goal One Read 52 books in 2020 Write a brief summary and takeaway for each book. Why? Books are an incredible dense source of material in which through active engagement, one can understand decades worth of research.

item.title: The Goal
item.description: What is the point of this? Mission • To Experiment, Document, and Augment 16 years old and still developing, my brain is in a rapid state of growth as I approach adulthood. I wanted to start this website because I believe that in this modern era, people unknowingly overstimulate themselves as they indulge in technological advancements primarily in entertainment. Our primitive lymbic system loves the binging and distracing as it’s primary purpose is to simply keep us alive.

item.title: About the Website
item.description: This site is built with Hugo and uses the hello-friend theme created by panr. Inspired by Jonathan Borichevskiy. Hosted on Github Pages.

item.title: Vibes Save Lives
item.description: Check out our video presentation to the City Council Of Cupertino by clicking here. This program won first at Hack Cupertino 2018, a city held hackthon. This project was one that was inspired by an interesting observation. Essentially, while listening to a sad Indian song I hypothesized that people that are depressed often listen to depressing/sad music as well. Through further research with the internet it turns out that my hypothesis was in fact correct.

item.title: Who am I?
item.description: My name is Ritvik Banakar, and I am currently a junior at Monta Vista High School. I am interested in app development, computer programming, and physics, and am planning on pursuing a major in Computer Science. Github • LinkedIn • Instagram • Devpost
